{{original research|date=May 2018}} {{more citations needed|date=May 2018}} {{undue weight|date=June 2016}} This is a list of '''important publications''' in [[medicine]], organized by field.
Some reasons why a particular publication might be regarded as important: *'''Topic creator''' – A publication that created a new topic *'''Breakthrough''' – A publication that changed scientific knowledge significantly *'''Influence''' – A publication which has significantly influenced the world or has had a massive impact on the teaching of medicine.<!-- The text of this lead section was substituted into this page from [[Template:List of publications intro]]. --><!--An entry in this list should include citations for statements about the importance of the publication. Otherwise it may be challenged and removed.-->
The definitive bibliographic source of books and articles demonstrating the history of medicine and identifying the first publications in the field is "Garrison and Morton". (Morton, Leslie T. (Leslie Thomas), Morton's medical bibliography : an annotated check-list of texts illustrating the history of medicine (Garrison and Morton). -- 5th ed. / edited by Jeremy M. Norman. -- Aldershot, Hants, England ; Brookfield, Vt., USA : Scolar Press, Gower, c1991. xxiv, 1243 p. {{ISBN|978-0-85967-897-1}}.) It is also available electronically, for a fee.
==Foundations== '''''De Materia Medica''''' :'''Author:''' [[Pedanius Dioscorides]] :'''Publication data:''' ''[[Materia medica|De Materia Medica]]'', 50–70 :'''Online version:''' [http://www.cancerlynx.com/BOOKONEAROMATICS.PDF Online version of first volume] :'''Description:''' This five-volume work was a precursor to all modern [[pharmacopeia]]s. In fact, it remained in use until the 16th century, though with some additional commentary and additions from [[Islamic medicine|Arabian]] and [[Ayurveda|Indian]] sources. :'''Importance:''' Topic creator, Breakthrough, Impact
'''''The Canon of Medicine''''' :'''Author:''' [[Avicenna]] (Ibn Sina) :'''Publication data:''' ''[[The Canon of Medicine]]'', 1025 :'''Description:''' This fourteen-volume [[Islamic medicine|medical encyclopedia]] was the first of its kind and remained the most popular medical textbook in both [[Europe]] and the [[Islamic Golden Age|Islamic world]] up until the 17th century and continued to be in use as late as the 19th century. Among other things, the book is known for the discovery of [[Infectious disease|contagious diseases]], and the introduction of [[experimental medicine]],<ref name=Huff>{{Cite book |first=Toby |last=Huff |year=2003 |title=The Rise of Early Modern Science: Islam, China, and the West |page=218 |publisher=[[Cambridge University Press]] |isbn=0-521-52994-8 |postscript=<!--None-->}}</ref> [[clinical trial]]s,<ref name=Tschanz>{{cite journal | author = Tschanz David W | year = 2003 | title = Arab Roots of European Medicine | url = | journal = Heart Views | volume = 4 | issue = 2 }}</ref> [[randomized controlled trial]]s,<ref name=Eldredge>{{cite journal | author = Eldredge Jonathan D | year = 2003 | title = The Randomised Controlled Trial design: unrecognized opportunities for health sciences librarianship | url = | journal = Health Information and Libraries Journal | volume = 20 | issue = | pages = 34–44 [36] | doi=10.1046/j.1365-2532.20.s1.7.x}}</ref><ref name=Bloom>{{cite journal |author1=Bloom Bernard S. |author2=Retbi Aurelia |author3=Dahan Sandrine |author4=Jonsson Egon | year = 2000 | title = Evaluation Of Randomized Controlled Trials On Complementary And Alternative Medicine | url = | journal = International Journal of Technology Assessment in Health Care | volume = 16 | issue = 1| pages = 13–21 [19] | doi=10.1017/s0266462300016123}}</ref> [[efficacy]] tests,<ref name=Brater-449>{{cite journal |author1=Brater D. Craig |author2=Daly Walter J. | year = 2000 | title = Clinical pharmacology in the Middle Ages: Principles that presage the 21st century | url = | journal = Clinical Pharmacology & Therapeutics | volume = 67 | issue = 5| pages = 447–450 [449] | doi=10.1067/mcp.2000.106465 | pmid=10824622}}</ref><ref name=Daly>{{cite journal |author1=Daly Walter J. |author2=Brater D. Craig | year = 2000 | title = Medieval contributions to the search for truth in clinical medicine | url = | journal = Perspectives in Biology and Medicine | volume = 43 | issue = 4| pages = 530–540 [536] | doi=10.1353/pbm.2000.0037 | pmid=11058989}}</ref> and [[clinical pharmacology]].<ref name=Brater-448>{{cite journal |author1=Brater D. Craig |author2=Daly Walter J. | year = 2000 | title = Clinical pharmacology in the Middle Ages: Principles that presage the 21st century | url = | journal = Clinical Pharmacology & Therapeutics | volume = 67 | issue = 5| pages = 447–450 [448] | doi=10.1067/mcp.2000.106465 | pmid=10824622}}</ref> The work is considered one of the most famous books in the [[history of medicine]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.britannica.com/eb/topic-92902/The-Canon-of-Medicine|title="The Canon of Medicine" (work by Avicenna)|publisher=''[[Encyclopædia Britannica]]''|year=2008|accessdate=2008-06-11}}</ref> :'''Importance:''' Topic creator, Breakthrough, Impact
'''''[[Exercitatio Anatomica de Motu Cordis et Sanguinis in Animalibus]]''''' :'''Author:''' [[William Harvey]] :'''Publication data:''' 1628 :'''Description:''' The work in which Harvey explained the [[circulation of the blood]].<ref>{{citation |title=The 100 Most Influential Scientists of All Time |chapter=William Harvey |pages=74–78 |isbn=978-1-61530-040-2 |year=2009}}</ref> :'''Importance:''' Breakthrough, Impact
'''''The Principles and Practice of Medicine: Designed for the Use of Practitioners and Students of Medicine''''' :'''Author:''' [[William Osler]] :'''Publication data: :'''Online version:''' :'''Description:''' First published in 1892 while Osler was Professor of Medicine at [[Johns Hopkins University]], [[The Principles and Practice of Medicine|this textbook]] was, in its time, translated into French, German, Russian, Portuguese, Spanish and Chinese. It became the most significant medical textbook of the next 40 years.<ref>Golden, Richard L. A history of William Osler's The principles and practice of medicine. Montreal, Quebec : Osler Library, McGill University, 2004. Osler Library studies in the history of medicine ; no. 8. {{ISBN|0-7717-0615-4}}</ref> :'''Importance:''' Impact
==Recent studies== '''''Mortality in relation to smoking: 50 years' observation on male British doctors''''' :'''Authors:''' R. Doll, R. Peto, J. Boreham, I. Sutherland :'''Publication data:''' ''[[BMJ]]'' 2004;328:1519–33. :'''Description:''' This is the [[British doctors study]]. A [[prospective study|prospective]] [[clinical trial]] which ran from 1951 to 2001, and in 1956 provided convincing statistical evidence that [[tobacco smoking]] increases the risk of [[lung cancer]]. :'''Importance:''' Impact
'''''Randomized trial of cholesterol lowering in 4444 patients with coronary heart disease: the Scandinavian Simvastatin Survival Study''''' :'''Authors:''' The [[Scandinavian Simvastatin Survival Study Group]]. :'''Publication data:''' ''[[The Lancet|Lancet]]'' 1994;344:1383–1389 :'''Description:''' The [[Scandinavian Simvastatin Survival Study]] (also known under the abbreviation ''4S'') is a multicenter [[clinical trial]] that was performed in the 1990s in [[Scandinavia]]. The objective of the study was to assess the effect of a [[cholesterol]]-lowering drug called [[simvastatin]] on [[death|mortality]] and [[morbidity]] in group of 4444 patients with [[coronary heart disease]], aged between 35 and 70 years. The patients presented with moderate [[hypercholesterolemia]] between 5.5 and 8.0 mmol/L. The results of the trial showed that simvastatin had a lowering effect on mortality and morbidity of patients suffering from coronary heart disease. :'''Importance:''' Impact
'''''Heart Protection Study''''' :'''Authors:''' [[Medical Research Council (UK)|Medical Research Council]] :'''Online version:''' [http://www.ctsu.ox.ac.uk/~hps/ Research site] :'''Description:''' The [[Heart Protection Study]] is a large [[randomized controlled trial]] by the Medical Research Council (MRC) in the [[United Kingdom]]. It studies the use of [[statin]] ([[simvastatin]] 40 mg) [[medication]] and [[vitamin]] supplementation ([[vitamin E]], [[vitamin C]] and [[carotene|beta carotene]]) in patients that are at risk for [[cardiovascular disease]]. :'''Importance:''' Impact
==Publications in medicine by field==
===[[Cardiology]]===
'''''Prophylactic implantation of a defibrillator in patients with myocardial infarction and reduced ejection fraction''''' :'''Authors:''' [[Arthur J. Moss|Moss AJ]], Zareba W, Hall WJ, Klein H, Wilber DJ, Cannom DS, Daubert JP, Higgins SL, Brown MW, Andrews ML; Multicenter Automatic Defibrillator Implantation Trial II Investigators.
:'''Publication data:''' [[N Engl J Med]]. 2002 Mar 21;346(12):877-83. Epub 2002 Mar 19. (MADIT 2) :'''Description:''' This study shows that anyone with [[coronary heart disease]] and decreased [[ejection fraction]] should receive an [[implantable cardioverter-defibrillator]]. :'''Importance:''' Impact
===[[Endocrinology]]===
'''''Pancreatic extracts in the treatment of [[diabetes mellitus]]'''''
:'''Author:''' Banting FG, Best CH, Collip JB, Campbell WR, Fletcher AA :'''Publication data:''' Canadian Medical Association Journal 1922;12:141-146. :'''Online version:''' [https://web.archive.org/web/20040909195509/http://www.jameslindlibrary.org/trial_records/20th_Century/1920s/banting/banting_whole_1.html Online version] :'''Description:''' Banting and Best proved the existence of the hypothetical pancreatic substance termed "[[insulin]]" by [[Edward Albert Sharpey-Schafer|Sharpey-Schafer]]. :'''Importance:''' Topic creator, Breakthrough, Impact
'''''Diabetes mellitus: its differentiation into insulin-sensitive and insulin-insensitive types.'''''
:'''Author:''' Himsworth HP :'''Publication data:''' [[The Lancet|Lancet]] 1936;i:127-130. :'''Online version:''' :'''Description:''' Himsworth noted that there are two main types of diabetes, the insulin-depleted (type 1) and the insulin-resistant form (type 2). [[Insulin resistance]] is a term and concept of his coinage. :'''Importance:''' Breakthrough, Impact

The clothing culture of [[Lurs]] is a very interesting aspect of this ethnic group which has been developed along with their long history of coexistence with surrounding natural elements across the [[Iranian plateau]], and geographical, cultural and religious effects.<ref>{{citation |title = Clothes of [[Feyli Lurs]] in [[Lorestan province|Luristan]], [[Ilam province|Ilam]] and [[Kermanshah province|Kermanshah]] |first=Issa |last=QaedRahmat |edition= illustrated, revised reprint |publisher=Motie Press, Qom |year=2014}}</ref><ref>{{citation |title = Lurish folk oral literature |first=Alimardan |last=Asgari Alam |edition= illustrated, revised reprint |publisher=Aron, Tehran |year=2009}}</ref><ref>{{citation |title = Documentary of local costumes in Luristan |first=Leila |last=Pahlevani |edition= illustrated, revised reprint |publisher=Luristan cultural heritage, handicrafts and tourism administration, KhorramAbad |year=2013}}</ref> This clothing system is a symbol of Lurish people although it varies due to geographical and seasonal conditions and between Lurish subgroups. The colors of Lurish costumes differ by the Lurs location. In a general classification Lurish clothes are in three main subgroups: Feyli (common between [[Feyli Lurs]] including [[Laks (Iran)|Laki]], [[Minjai]], Kalhori and Maleki tribes), [[Bakhtiari people|Bakhtiari]] (Common between Bakhtiari Charlang and Haftlang clans) and Southern Lurish (common between [[Southern Lurs]]).<ref>{{citation |title = Clothes of Feyli Lurs in Luristan, Ilam and Kermanshah |first=Issa |last=QaedRahmat |edition= illustrated, revised reprint |publisher=Motie Press, Qom |year=2014}}</ref> [[File:LurishFemaleCostume.jpg|thumb|250px| Lurish Mother "DA" statute, Delfan, Luristan|right]] [[File:Southern Lurish Female and Male Costume.jpg|thumb|[[Southern Lurs|Southern Lurish]] Female and Male Costumes]]
==Men's clothing==
===Shaal=== Shaal (شال): A long white cloth (width: 60–90 cm, length: 6–9 meters) made by chalvar nature which is twisted all round the waist.
===Setra=== Setra (سِتره): A special cassock that its size is below the knees and usually is used for more official ceremonies. This clothes is one of the oldest types of clothing in Iran. [[File:FeyliLurishClothes.jpg|thumb|Feyli Lurish clothes]]
===Felt hats=== Felt hats (کُلأ نِمِدی): A round felt made that has no edges and sometimes is surrounded by Golvani.<ref>{{citation |title = Clothing of tribes, nomads and villagers in Iran |first=Jalil |last=Ziapour |edition= illustrated, revised reprint |publisher=Aron, Tehran |year=1967}}</ref>
===Giva=== Giva(گیوه): A local handmade shoes with sturdy leather or plastic soles and the vamp is woven by spun yarn.
===Chugha=== [[File:A Bakhtiari man.jpg|thumb|Traditional male costume of Bakhtiari Lurs]] Chugha (چوغا): A masculine wrapper that is used prominently by [[Bakhtiari people|Bakhtiari Lurs]] and [[Feyli Lurs]]. Chugha is made by sheep wool and usually is woven by Bakhtiari nomads.<ref name="iranica-fayli">{{cite web|last1=Oberling|first1=Pierre|title=CLOTHING xxv. Clothing of the Baḵtīārīs and other Lori speaking tribes – Encyclopaedia Iranica|url=http://www.iranicaonline.org/articles/clothing-xxv|website=www.iranicaonline.org|publisher=Encyclopedia Iranica|accessdate=22 January 2017|language=en}}</ref>
==Women's clothing==
===Juma=== Juma (جومه) or Kraas(کراس): A free, tall and without a collar dress which is a common clothing of Lurish women all across [[Lurs|Luristan]].
===Kolonja=== Kolonja (کُلُنجه): is a lacing overcoat which in many cases, the surface is embroidered and decorated by coins.
===Saava=== Saava (ساوه): A special [[silk]] fabric that Lur women tie around the head.
===Golvani=== Golvani (گُلوَنی): A colorful and patterned type of Saava that mostly is used for celebration and joy. In recent years, Golvani is mentioned as an ethnic symbol of [[Lurs]] and every year is celebrated on a certain day (May 16) during spring season.[[File:LurishGolvai.jpg|thumb|250px|Golvani|center]]
==References== {{reflist}} <!-- After listing your sources please cite them using inline citations and place them after the information they cite. Please see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:REFB for instructions on how to add citations. --> * * * *

{{Infobox language |name=Nafusi |nativename=''Maziɣ'' |states=[[Libya]] |speakers={{sigfig|140,000|2}} |date=2006 |ref=<ref>E. K. Brown, R. E. Asher & J. M. Y. Simpson, ''Encyclopedia of language & linguistics, Volume 1'', p.155 (Elsevier, 2006, {{ISBN|9780080442990}})</ref> |familycolor=Afro-Asiatic |fam2=[[Berber languages|Berber]] |fam3=[[Eastern Berber languages|Eastern]]? |iso3=jbn |glotto=nafu1238 |glottorefname=Nafusi }} '''Nafusi''' (also spelt '''Nefusi'''; [[Berber languages|Berber]]: ''Maziɣ'') is a [[Berber language]] spoken in the [[Nafusa Mountains]] (''Drar n infusen''), a large area in northwestern [[Libya]]. Its primary speakers are the [[Ibadi]]te communities around [[Jadu, Libya|Jadu]], [[Nalut]] (''Lalut'') and [[Yafran]].
The dialect of Yefren in the east differs somewhat from that of Nalut and Jadu in the west.<ref>Beguinot 1931:VIII</ref> A number of Old Nafusi phrases appear in Ibadite manuscripts as early as the 12th century.<ref>Tadeusz Lewicki, "De quelques textes inédits en vieux berbère provenant d'une chronique ibāḍite anonyme" and André Basset, "Note additionnelle", ''Revue des études islamiques'' VIII, 1934, pp. 277, 298</ref>
The ''[[Ethnologue]]'' entry includes nearby [[Zuara Berber]], [[Matmata Berber]] and [[Djerbi language|Djerbi]] under the rubric "Nafusi", which corresponds to neither local nor to academic usage of the term.
The dialect of Jadu is described in some detail in Beguinot (1931).<ref>Francesco Beguinot, ''Il berbero nefûsi di Fassâṭo: grammatica, testi raccolti dalla viva voce, vocabolarietti''. Roma: Istituto per l'Oriente 1931</ref> Motylinski (1898) describes the dialect of Jadu and Nalut as spoken by a student from Yefren.<ref>p. 1, A. de Calassanti-Motylinski, ''Le Djebel Nefousa: transcription, traduction française et notes, avec une étude grammaticale'', Paris: Ernest Leroux, 1898.</ref>
Nafusi shares several innovations with the [[Zenati languages]], but unlike these other Berber varieties it maintains prefix vowels before open syllables. For example, ''ufəs'' "hand" < *''afus'', rather than Zenati ''fus''. It appears especially closely related to [[Sokna language|Sokni]] and [[Siwi language|Siwi]] to its east.<ref>Maarten Kossmann, 1999, ''Essai sur la phonologie du proto-berbère'', Köln: Rüdiger Köppe, pp. 29-33</ref>

|url=http://www.zeit.de/gesellschaft/2016-01/koeln-verdaechtige-asylbewerber-bundespolizei-silvester |date=8 January 2016 |accessdate=8 January 2016 |language=de}}</ref><ref name="welt2"/> | susperps = | perps = | numparts = At least two convictions of sexual assault<ref name=nomeansno/>
4 convictions of non-sex-related crimes<ref name=washpost11jul/>
2,000+ alleged<ref name="Rick Noack">{{cite web|author=Rick Noack|title=Leaked document says 2,000 men allegedly assaulted 1,200 German women on New Year's Eve|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2016/07/10/leaked-document-says-2000-men-allegedly-assaulted-1200-german-women-on-new-years-eve/|publisher=The Washington Post|accessdate=10 July 2016}}</ref> }}
During the 2015/2016 [[New Year's Eve]] celebrations, there were [[mass sexual assaults]], 24 [[rape]]s, and numerous [[theft]]s in [[Germany]], mainly in the [[Cologne]] city center. There were similar incidents at the public celebrations in [[Hamburg]], [[Dortmund]], [[Düsseldorf]], [[Stuttgart]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.stuttgarter-nachrichten.de/inhalt.uebergriff-auf-frauen-in-silvesternacht-weitere-mutmassliche-opfer-in-stuttgart.dfe30c13-9ce5-4bc3-b80f-eac86485ae96.html |title=Übergriff auf Frauen in Silvesternacht: Weitere mutmaßliche Opfer in Stuttgart |trans-title=Attacks on women New Year's Eve: More alleged victims in Stuttgart |author=Andrea Beckmann |accessdate=5 January 2016 |website=Stuttgarter Nachrichten |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160127063942/http://www.stuttgarter-nachrichten.de/inhalt.uebergriff-auf-frauen-in-silvesternacht-weitere-mutmassliche-opfer-in-stuttgart.dfe30c13-9ce5-4bc3-b80f-eac86485ae96.html |archive-date=27 January 2016 }}</ref> and [[Bielefeld]].<ref name="faz">{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/inland/koeln-meldet-inzwischen-106-anzeigen-nach-uebergriffen-an-silvester-14000124.html|title=Mehr als 100 Anzeigen nach Übergriffen an Silvester |trans-title=More than 100 reports of assaults on New Year's Eve |work=[[Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref name="welt9">{{cite web |url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article150798244/Hunderte-sollen-Bielefelder-Disco-attackiert-haben.html|title=Hunderte sollen Bielefelder Disco attackiert haben |trans-title=Hundreds allegedly attacked Bielefeld Disco |work=[[Die Welt]] |accessdate=5 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref name="rp">{{cite web |url=http://www.rp-online.de/nrw/panorama/bielefeld-junge-frauen-durch-antanztrick-sexuell-belaestigt-aid-1.5671781 |title=Bielefeld: Junge Frauen durch Antanztrick sexuell belästigt |trans-title=Bielefeld: Young women molested on the dance floor |work=RP ONLINE |accessdate=5 January 2016}}</ref> For all of Germany, police estimated in a document leaked in 2016 that 1,200 women were sexually assaulted and that at least 2,000 men were involved, often acting in groups.<ref name="Rick Noack"/>
Many of the incidents involved women being surrounded and assaulted by groups of men on the street.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rp-online.de/nrw/staedte/duesseldorf/blaulicht/duesseldorf-mehr-faelle-von-sexueller-belaestigung-41-anzeigen-aid-1.5677740 |title=Düsseldorf - Mehr Fälle von sexueller Belästigung: 41 Anzeigen |trans-title=Dusseldorf - More cases of sexual harassment: 41 reports |work=RP ONLINE |language=de |accessdate=16 February 2016}}</ref><ref name=BBCnewsreport/> Cologne police chief Wolfgang Albers stated that the perpetrators in his city were reportedly men of "[[Arab people|Arab]] or [[North Africa]]n appearance" and said that Germany had never experienced such mass sexual assaults before.<ref name=DW3>{{cite news|title=String of New Year's Eve sexual assaults outrages Cologne|url=http://www.dw.com/en/string-of-new-years-eve-sexual-assaults-outrages-cologne/a-18958334|accessdate=24 January 2016|publisher=Deutsche Welle|date=4 January 2016}}</ref><ref name=BBCnewsreport/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-europe-migrants-germany-challenges-in-idUSKCN0V6173 |title=Cologne attacks show Germany unprepared for migration challenge |website=Reuters |date=28 January 2016 |accessdate=18 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/reports-of-new-years-eve-sexual-assaults-feed-into-german-debate-over-migrant-crisis-145200420 |title=Reports of New Year's Eve Sexual Assaults Feed Into German Debate Over Migrant Crisis |website=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |date=5 January 2016 |accessdate=18 May 2016}}</ref><ref name=LocalNotOrganized/> The attacks sparked an international outcry, a debate about [[women's rights]] (especially in [[Islam]]ic culture), the sustainability of [[Asylum in Germany|Germany's asylum policy]], and [[violence]] and [[sexism]] against [[women]] by [[immigrant]]s from Arab countries and North Africa. Taking place during the [[European migrant crisis]] (see [[Timeline of the European migrant crisis|timeline]]), the attacks also led to a hardening of attitudes against immigration and attacks on immigrants.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://yougov.co.uk/news/2016/01/12/germans-attitudes-immigration-harden-following-col/ |title=German attitudes to immigration harden following Cologne attacks |website=[[YouGov]] |date=12 January 2016 |accessdate=18 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Moulson|first1=Geir|title=Germany: Pakistanis, Syrian attacked in Cologne amid tension|url=https://apnews.com/f866ee3b338044c0a6cf0e7940dbdf0c/germany-pakistanis-syrian-attacked-cologne-amid-tension|accessdate=9 January 2018|agency=Associated Press|date=11 January 2016}}</ref>
Only a small number of the alleged perpetrators have been identified. By 9 April, police in Cologne had identified 153 suspects, 24 of whom were in investigative custody.<ref name="waz2">{{cite web|url=https://www.derwesten.de/politik/1075-anzeigen-nach-koelner-silvesternacht-73-verdaechtige-id11567004.html| title=Kölner Silvester-Angriffe: 1075 Anzeigen und 73 Verdächtige |trans-title=Cologne's New Year's Eve assaults: 1,075 complaints and 73 suspects |work=[[Westdeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung]] |language=German |accessdate=15 February 2016}}</ref><ref name="szg"/><ref name="spi">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/koeln-silvesteruebergriffe-die-ermittlungsergebnisse-a-1085716.html|title=Mehr als 1500 Straftaten: Die Ermittlungsergebnisse zur Kölner Silvesternacht| trans-title=More than 1500 offenses: Cologne New Year's Eve Investigation results |work=[[Der Spiegel]]|accessdate=9 April 2016|language=German}}</ref><ref name="nrw2"/><ref name="ds4"/> Almost all of the suspects of the Cologne crimes were non-Germans; two-thirds of them from [[Morocco]] or [[Algeria]]. 68 suspects were asylum seekers; 18 were residing in Germany illegally, and the legal status of 47 others was unclear. Four suspects were underage, unaccompanied refugees.<ref name="spi"/><ref name="welt.de">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/newsticker/news1/article150770251/Polizei-identifiziert-nach-Koelner-Uebergriffen-weitere-Verdaechtige.html |title=Polizei identifiziert nach Kölner Übergriffen weitere Verdächtige |trans-title=Police identify more suspects following Cologne assaults |publisher=Die Welt |accessdate=24 January 2016}}</ref><ref name="ds3">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/koeln-ralf-jaeger-haelt-silvester-taeter-fuer-nicht-hierarchisch-strukturiert-a-1073197.html |title=Kölner Silvesternacht: Polizei geht nicht von Absprachen unter Tätern aus |trans-title=Cologne New Year's Eve: Police not assuming that perpetrators colluded in advance |work=[[Der Spiegel]] |accessdate=25 August 2018|date=21 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref name="welt4">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article150857513/Das-wissen-die-Ermittler-ueber-die-Koeln-Tatverdaechtigen.html|title=Übergriffe an Silvester in Köln: Das wissen die Ermittler über die Tatverdächtigen |trans-title=Cologne New Year's Eve Assaults: What investigators know about the suspects |accessdate=11 January 2016|work=DIE WELT}}</ref><ref name="sz">{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/news/panorama/kriminalitaet-jetzt-553-strafanzeigen-in-koeln---23-verdaechtige-bekannt-dpa.urn-newsml-dpa-com-20090101-160111-99-859355 |title=Jetzt 553 Strafanzeigen in Köln - 23 Verdächtige bekannt | trans-title=Latest: 553 criminal complaints in Cologne - 23 suspects known |work=[[Süddeutsche Zeitung]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref name=TDTJH070416>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/04/07/german-minister-told-police-to-remove-the-word-rape-from-cologne/|title=German minister 'told police to remove the word rape from Cologne sex assault report'|author=Justin Huggler|work=The Daily Telegraph|date=7 April 2016|accessdate=9 April 2016}}</ref> By July, four perpetrators had been convicted,<ref name="washpost11jul">{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2016/07/10/leaked-document-says-2000-men-allegedly-assaulted-1200-german-women-on-new-years-eve/|title=Leaked document says 2,000 men allegedly assaulted 1,200 German women on New Year's Eve|date=11 July 2016|website=The Washington Post|accessdate=17 July 2016}}</ref> and it was reported that half of the 120 outstanding suspects had been in Germany for less than a year,<ref name="Rick Noack">{{cite web|author=Rick Noack|title=Leaked document says 2,000 men allegedly assaulted 1,200 German women on New Year's Eve|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2016/07/10/leaked-document-says-2000-men-allegedly-assaulted-1200-german-women-on-new-years-eve/|publisher=The Washington Post|accessdate=10 July 2016}}</ref> most of them from North Africa.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/uebergriffe-in-koeln-frauen-wurden-opfer-von-silvester-gewalt-1.3072064|title=1200 Frauen wurden Opfer von Silvester-Gewalt|trans-title=1,200 women were victims of violence Silvester|work=[[Süddeutsche Zeitung]]|date=10 July 2016|accessdate=14 August 2016|language=German}}</ref>
It was speculated that the assaults in Cologne were organized. Police said that some perpetrators used [[social media]] to meet for New Year's Eve celebrations,<ref name=LocalNotOrganized>{{cite web|title=Cologne attacks 'not organized': police chief|date=12 February 2016|work=The Local|url=http://www.thelocal.de/20160212/cologne-attacks-were-not-organized-police-chief}}</ref><ref name="ds3"/><ref name="fc"/><ref name=socialmedia>{{cite web|title=Cologne mass sex attack 'was organised and plotted on social media' says police chief|date=12 February 2016|work=Daily Express|url=http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/643468/Cologne-mass-sex-attack-frenzy-New-Year-social-media}}</ref> but [[Ralf Jäger]], Minister of the Interior of [[North Rhine-Westphalia]], said there was "so far no evidence that the perpetrators had arranged the assaults before New Year's Eve".<ref name="ds3"/> Jürgen Mathies, the new Cologne police chief, said many of the perpetrators were from countries where they might be familiar with "this behaviour, where women are hemmed in and then abused by a large number of men at once".<ref name=LocalNotOrganized/><ref name=socialmedia/> According to both Jäger and Mathies, the suspects did not come from [[pickpocketing]] or [[organized crime]] gangs.<ref name=LocalNotOrganized/><ref name="ds3"/><ref name=socialmedia/>
The Cologne assaults were not reported by the national media for days, and ''[[The Local]]'' says many news outlets started reporting it only after a wave of anger on social media made covering the story unavoidable.<ref name="thelocaldesilence"/> This led to claims that the [[Lying press|media is forced into line and was attempting to cover up]] crimes by immigrants.<ref>{{cite web|title=Cover-up claim over NYE mass sexual assaults|date=4 January 2016|work=[[The Local]]|url=https://www.thelocal.de/20160104/refugees-blamed-for-mass-sexual-assault-in-cologne}}</ref> Although Cologne Mayor [[Henriette Reker]] condemned the assaults, she was strongly criticized for some of her comments and was accused of [[victim blaming|blaming the victims]]. Cologne's police chief, [[Wolfgang Albers (police president)|Wolfgang Albers]], was transferred to provisional retirement for his handling of the situation. The police response and delayed media reaction met strong criticism from German citizens, with some placing blame on the [[European migrant crisis]].<ref name="BBCnewsreport">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-35231046|title=Germany Shocked by Cologne New Year Gang Assaults on Women|date=5 January 2016|work=[[BBC News]]|accessdate=7 January 2016}}</ref> The governments of [[Slovakia]] and the [[Czech Republic]] called for an emergency EU meeting following the assaults and various other EU governments made statements concerning the attacks.
On 7 June, a [[Federal Criminal Police Office (Germany)|Federal Criminal Police Office]] report confirmed that most of the perpetrators were of North African origin and had arrived in Germany during the European migrant crisis. Investigative results about the perpetrators were congruent with witnesses' statements.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rp-online.de/politik/deutschland/berlin/blog/silvester-nacht-von-koeln-taeter-kamen-mit-fluechtlingswelle-ins-land-aid-1.6034491|title=Silvester-Täter kamen mit Flüchtlingswelle ins Land|trans-title=Silvester - perpetrators came with wave of refugees into the country|work=Rheinische Post|date=9 June 2016|accessdate=23 June 2016|language=German}}</ref> Perpetrators benefited from weak criminal prosecution and low police presence. [[Group dynamics]] and personal frustration among the offenders also fuelled the crimes. The report also linked the assaults to the purported phenomenon of ''[[Mass sexual assault in Egypt|taharrush jamai]]'' (collective harassment)<ref name="huff1">{{cite web|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/alex-shams/sexism-isnt-an-arab-cultural-practice_b_9022056.html|title=Taharrush Gamea and sexism are not Arabic cultural practices|work=Huffington Post|accessdate=25 December 2017}}</ref> in some Arab countries.<ref name="weltbka">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article156038699/Polizeiversagen-bestaerkte-die-Koelner-Sex-Taeter.html|title=Polizeiversagen bestärkte die Kölner Sex-Täter|trans-title=Police failure encouraged the Cologne sex offenders|work=Die Welt|date=7 June 2016|accessdate=23 June 2016|language=German}}</ref>
Following the attacks, Germany updated its laws, making it easier to deport immigrants convicted of [[Sex and the law|sex crimes]] and broadening the definition of sexual assault to include any sexual act that a victim declines through verbal or physical cues. Previously German law required a victim to physically resist their attacker<ref name=nomeansno>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-36726095|title=Germany rape law: 'No means No' law passed|date=7 July 2016|work=[[BBC News]]|accessdate=7 January 2017}}</ref> (see [[rape in Germany]]).
==Events==
===Cologne=== [[File:Köln nach Silvestervorfällen 2015-16-4149.jpg|thumb|Cologne main square between the [[Köln Hauptbahnhof|central railway station]] and the city's [[Cologne Cathedral|cathedral]] was the main site of the robberies and assaults.]] On New Year's Eve, December 2015, witnesses reported that [[firecracker]]s were thrown into a crowd from a group of people of around 500, which had doubled in size by later that night, at the square in front of [[Köln Hauptbahnhof|Cologne's Central Station]].<ref name=local>{{cite news|title=Cover-up claim over NYE mass sexual assaults|url=http://www.thelocal.de/20160104/refugees-blamed-for-mass-sexual-assault-in-cologne|accessdate=24 January 2016|publisher=The Local|date=4 January 2016}}</ref> Following this event, groups of men exploited the confusion to rob and [[Sexual assault|sexually assault]] people in the area and within the station.<ref name="local"/><ref name="dz"/> According to witnesses, the attackers surrounded women in groups of 30–40.<ref name="TheGuardJan6"/>
According to the Cologne police report on 2 January, the suspects mostly used [[sexual assault]] (including [[groping]]) to distract victims while robbing them of mobile phones and wallets. Police initially said that the sizes of the groups ranged from 2 to 20 people.<ref name="police">{{cite news |title=POL-K: 160102-1-K Übergriffe am Bahnhofsvorplatz - Ermittlungsgruppe gegründet |trans-title=Assaults at train station plaza - investigation team established |url=http://www.presseportal.de/blaulicht/pm/12415/3215530|work=presseportal.de|language=de|accessdate=24 January 2016}}</ref> According to a Bundeskriminalamt report released in June 2016, perpetrators acted mostly in groups of 9 up to 100 men. Groping, insults, and rape were often combined with robbery and theft.<ref name="weltbka"/>
A female undercover police officer was sexually assaulted, the offender grabbing into her pants.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rp-online.de/nrw/staedte/koeln/uebergriffe-auf-frauen-in-koeln-taeter-packte-zivilpolizistin-in-die-hose-aid-1.5667697 |title=Täter packte Zivilpolizistin in die Hose |trans-title=Perpetrators grabbed policewoman in the pants |work=[[Rheinische Post]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> In other cases, the victims' underwear was torn off.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.n24.de/n24/Nachrichten/Panorama/d/7863002/-man-hatte-ihr-den-slip-vom-koerper-gerissen-.html|title=Man hatte ihr den Slip vom Körper gerissen |trans-title=Her panties were torn off |work=[[N24 (Germany)|N24]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> Media reports included the case of an American woman, who was protected by [[Syrian people|Syrian]] men who formed a ring around her and then brought her to her boyfriend.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/panorama/koeln-amerikanerin-in-koeln-syrische-maenner-schuetzten-mich-1.2822099 |title=Amerikanerin in Köln: Syrische Männer schützten mich |trans-title=American woman in Cologne: Syrian men protected me |work=[[Süddeutsche Zeitung]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> One victim described a firecracker being put in the hood of her jacket while her personal belongings were stolen.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-35250903|title=Cologne sex attacks: Women describe 'terrible' assaults|work=BBC News|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref>
On 5 January, shortly after the assaults, Cologne mayor [[Henriette Reker]] said in a press conference that there was "no evidence that people who are residing in Cologne as refugees are amongst the perpetrators". Cologne's police president, [[Wolfgang Albers (police president)|Wolfgang Albers]], stated that "the police has no knowledge about the offenders".<ref name="dz">{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/news/2016-01/05/kriminalitaet-polizei-hat-nach-uebergriffen-keine-erkenntnisse-ueber-taeter-05161803 |title=Polizei hat nach Übergriffen keine Erkenntnisse über Täter |trans-title=Police lack information about criminals after assaults |work=[[Die Zeit]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> To some, including the German Minister of Justice [[Heiko Maas]], the assaults appeared to have been organized or coordinated, the perpetrators having arrived in large groups.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/sexuelle-uebergriffe-in-koeln-das-ganze-scheint-abgesprochen-gewesen-zu-sein-13999522.html |title=Das Ganze scheint abgesprochen gewesen zu sein |trans-title=The whole thing seems to have been prearranged |work=[[Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> Police later said that some perpetrators used [[social media]] to meet at the New Year's Eve celebrations,<ref name=LocalNotOrganized/><ref name="ds3"/><ref name="fc"/><ref name=socialmedia/> but [[Ralf Jäger]], Minister of the Interior of [[North Rhine-Westphalia]], said there was "so far no evidence that the perpetrators had arranged the assaults before New Year's Eve".<ref name="ds3"/> According to Jäger in January and Jürgen Mathies, the new Cologne police chief in February, the suspects did not come from [[pickpocketing]] or [[organized crime]] gangs.<ref name=LocalNotOrganized/><ref name="ds3"/><ref name=socialmedia/>
According to Albers, most alleged perpetrators seemed men "of Arab or North African appearance" between the ages of 15 and 35 or between 18 and 35 (news media report differently).<ref name=NYT>{{cite news |title=Reports of Attacks on Women in Germany Heighten Tension Over Migrants |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/01/06/world/europe/coordinated-attacks-on-women-in-cologne-were-unprecedented-germany-says.html |work=The New York Times |accessdate=5 January 2016 |author=Eddy, Melissa}}</ref><ref name=DW>{{cite news|title=A 'new dimension' of sexual assault in Cologne |url=http://www.dw.com/en/a-new-dimension-of-sexual-assault-in-cologne/a-18959299 |work=DW |accessdate=5 January 2016}}</ref><ref name=BBC>{{cite news|title=Germany shocked by Cologne New Year gang assaults on women|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-35231046|accessdate=5 January 2016}}</ref><ref name=Independent3>{{cite news|title=German police search for 1,000 men after mass sexual assault in Cologne|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/german-police-search-for-1000-men-after-mass-sexual-assault-in-cologne-a6797126.html|accessdate=5 January 2016}}</ref>
On 7 January, several anonymous police officers from Cologne denied statements that the police did not know the nationality of the perpetrators; they told the press that "most of them" would have been freshly arrived asylum seekers. Contradicting statements from Cologne police leaders, these officers said that the identities of many people, including those who were arrested, had been thoroughly checked, so that police knew which groups of people were involved.<ref name="welt"/>
Around 70 people had been checked, and several brought to police stations or taken into custody. The majority of those in detention were [[Syrian people|Syrians]].<ref name="welt"/> The officers denied that the sexual harassment was only incidental, saying the truth was "exactly the opposite" and that most of the perpetrators sought primarily to commit sexual offenses, or in their words "sexual amusement".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article150733779/Vorrangig-ging-es-den-Taetern-um-Sexualstraftaten.html |title=Vorrangig ging es den Tätern um Sexualstraftaten |trans-title=The perpetrators primarily sought to commit sexual offenses |work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> Arnold Plickert, North Rhine Westphalia's representative of German police union ''[[Gewerkschaft der Polizei]]'', confirmed that asylum seekers were "definitely" involved.<ref name="welt">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article150735341/Die-meisten-waren-frisch-eingereiste-Asylbewerber.html|title=Die meisten waren frisch eingereiste Asylbewerber |trans-title=Most were recently-arrived asylum seekers |work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/koeln-nach-silvester-attacken-fluechtlinge-laut-polizeigewerkschaft-unter-verdacht-a-1071005.html |title=Übergriffe an Silvester: Auch Flüchtlinge unter Verdächtigen in Köln |trans-title=New Year's Eve Assaults: Refugees also under suspicion in Cologne |work=[[Der Spiegel]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref>
On 8 January, the [[Federal Ministry of the Interior (Germany)|Federal Ministry of the Interior]] acknowledged that two-thirds of the suspects checked by the [[Federal Police (Germany)|Federal Police]]—who are responsible for the railways and railway stations in Germany—in Cologne were asylum seekers. The same report stated that 31 suspects were identified by name, including 18 asylum seekers. In total, the suspects were nine [[Algeria]]ns, eight [[Morocco|Moroccans]], four Syrians, five [[Iran]]ians, two [[Germany|Germans]], an [[Iraq]]i, a [[Serb]], and an [[United States|American]].<ref name="welt.de"/> Another report on the same day stated that stolen mobile phones were located by the police within or in the vicinity of refugees' residences.<ref name="ds2"/>
By 8 January, 170 women had reported crimes to the police, including two rapes, with the events taking place in the main square between the station and [[Cologne Cathedral]], and also outside the central railway station.<ref name="faz"/><ref name="ts">{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesspiegel.de/politik/nach-uebergriffen-in-koeln-polizei-stockt-ermittlungsgruppe-deutlich-auf/12796734.html|title=Polizei stockt Ermittlungsgruppe deutlich auf|trans-title=Police investigation team significantly strengthened |work=[[Der Tagesspiegel]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref name="ds2">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/koeln-spur-gestohlener-handys-fuehrt-auch-in-fluechtlingsheime-a-1071075.html| title=Silvesternacht in Köln: Ermittler orten gestohlene Handys in Flüchtlingsheimen |trans-title=Cologne New Year's Eve: investigators locate stolen cellphones in refugee camps |work=[[Der Spiegel]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref name="ds">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/koeln-das-steht-im-internen-polizeibericht-zur-silvesternacht-a-1070837.html |title=Interner Polizeibericht zu Kölner Silvesternacht: "Es waren einfach zu viele zur gleichen Zeit" |trans-title=Internal police report on Cologne New Year's Eve: "There were just too many at the same time" |work=[[Der Spiegel]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref name="focus">{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/regional/koeln/betroffene-im-interview-sex-uebergriffe-in-koeln-die-massen-an-maennern-waren-beaengstigend_id_5191550.html |title=Als meine Freundin hinfiel, haben sich direkt vier Männer auf sie gestürzt |trans-title=When my friend fell down, suddenly four men fell right on top of her |work=Focus.de|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> The number increased to 379 on the following day, and sexual offences were alleged in 40 percent of these cases. Most of the suspects were described as men of North African appearance. The increase in reported crimes was attributed to the fact that more officers have been assigned to the investigation, so complaints from more police stations are being evaluated. Many of the attacked women were visitors of, or travellers passing through Cologne.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article150811301/So-erklaert-die-Polizei-200-neue-Strafanzeigen.html |title=So erklärt die Polizei 200 neue Strafanzeigen |trans-title=Police explain 200 new criminal complaints this way |work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=31 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> By 11 January, the number of complaints was 553, with sexual offences comprising nearly half of the cases.<ref name="sz"/>
The next day, it was reported that the number had risen to 653, but a correction made later on set the number at 561. According to the department of public prosecution, there has been a transmission error ("Übermittlungsfehler").<ref name="spiegel">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/koeln-mehr-als-650-anzeigen-wegen-uebergriffen-zu-silvester-a-1071692.html |title=Übergriffe in Köln: Zahl der Anzeigen steigt auf mehr als 650 |trans-title=Cologne Attacks: Number of complaints filed increases to more than 650 |work=[[Der Spiegel]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.tagesschau.de/inland/koeln-uebergriffe-109.html|title=Was wir über Köln wissen |trans-title=What we know about Cologne |work=[[Tagesschau (Germany)|Tagesschau]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> By 14 January, the number rose again to 652,<ref name="spiegel3">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/koeln-staatsanwaltschaft-setzt-10-000-euro-belohnung-aus-a-1071990.html |title=Übergriffe in Köln: Staatsanwaltschaft setzt 10.000 Euro Belohnung aus |trans-title=Cologne Attacks: Public Prosecutor's Office offers 10,000 Euro reward |work=[[Der Spiegel]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> by 15 January to 676 complaints, 347 of these including sexual offences.<ref name="rp2"/> On 19 January, the number of complaints was at 766,<ref name="welt7"/> rising to 821 on 21 January, including 359 sexual offences.<ref name="ds3"/> The number of victims is higher, as some complaints included more than one victim: 1,049 people were affected in total as of 21 January.<ref name="rp2">{{cite web|url=http://www.rp-online.de/nrw/landespolitik/uebergriffe-in-koeln-aid-1.5693992 |title=NRW-Opposition will Untersuchungsausschuss |trans-title=NRW Opposition wants board of inquiry |work=[[Rheinische Post]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref name="welt7">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article151144503/Erster-Verdaechtiger-wegen-Sexualstraftat-in-Koeln-in-U-Haft.html |title=Erster Verdächtiger wegen Sexualstraftat in Köln in U-Haft |trans-title=First suspect for Cologne sexual offenses in custody |work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref name="ds3"/> Three women were allegedly raped.<ref |trans-title=This can happen again any time |work=[[Frankfurter Allgemeine]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref name="welt7"/><ref name="focus2">{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/politik/deutschland/innenausschuss-im-live-ticker-straftaten-verdaechtige-jetzt-legt-nrw-innenminister-jaeger-die-wahren-zahlen-vor_id_5226649.html |title=Straftaten,
