magazine)|Focus]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> By 30 January, the number of complaints in Cologne was 1,016, 433 of which included sexual offences.<ref name="kr">{{cite web|url=http://www.rundschau-online.de/koeln/koelner-karneval-auf-cnn-internationale-medien-berichten-an-weiberfastnacht,15185496,33677710.html |title=Internationale Medien berichten an Weiberfastnacht |trans-title=International media at Cologne Carnival report on Women's Turnabout Day |work=[[Kölnische Rundschau]]|accessdate=31 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> On 10 February, the number of complaints had risen again to 1,054. Alleged sexual offences were included in 454 cases, while the other cases consisted mostly of theft, robbery, and personal injuries.<ref name="sz2">{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/news/panorama/kriminalitaet-1054-strafanzeigen-nach-der-koelner-silvesternacht-dpa.urn-newsml-dpa-com-20090101-160210-99-605917|title=1054 Strafanzeigen nach der Kölner Silvesternacht |trans-title=1,054 criminal complaints following Cologne's New Year's Eve celebration |work=[[Süddeutsche Zeitung]]|accessdate=11 February 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> The number of complaints rose again to 1,075 by February 15; 467 included sexual offences.<ref name="waz2"/> By 17 March, it had risen to more than 1,100.<ref name="szg"/> As of 18 March, the Cologne Public Prosecutor reported 1,139 crime complaints filed during New Year's Eve, 485 of which were sexual offences.<ref name="szg2">{{cite news |title=Polizisten machen widersprüchliche Aussagen zu Kölner Silvesternacht |trans-title=Police make contradictory statements about Cologne New Year's Eve |url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/panorama/untersuchungsausschuss-polizisten-machen-widerspruechliche-aussagen-zu-koelner-silvesternacht-1.2914635|accessdate=7 April 2016|work=Süddeutsche Zeitung|date=18 March 2016|language=German|quote=Bislang wurden laut Staatsanwaltschaft Köln 1139 Anzeigen gestellt, davon 485 wegen einer Sexualstraftat.}}</ref> By 6 April, the number of reported crimes in Cologne was 1,529. A total of 1,218 victims were involved, 529 of which were victims of sexual offences.<ref name="spi"/> In July, it was estimated that more than 600 women had been assaulted in Cologne.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/world/2016/07/11/2000-men-allegedly-sexually-assaulted-1200-women-in-germany-on-nye-document.html|title=2,000 men allegedly sexually assaulted 1,200 women in Germany on NYE: police leak|work=The Star|accessdate=11 July 2016|author=Rick Noack}}</ref>
Some complaints also included the allegation of denial of assistance and obstruction of justice in office against Wolfgang Albers and some police officers,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.n-tv.de/politik/Anzeigen-gegen-Koelner-Polizei-eingegangen-article16761856.html |title=Anzeigen gegen Kölner Polizei eingegangen |trans-title=Complaints against Cologne police received |work=[[n-tv]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> as well as the North Rhine-Westphalia Minister of the Interior, [[Ralf Jäger]].<ref name="expr"/> By 17 March, the number of such complaints was 51.<ref name="expr">{{cite web|url=http://www.express.de/koeln/silvester-mob-51-strafanzeigen-gegen-wolfgang-albers-und-ralf-jaeger-23745054 |title=Silvester-Mob: 51 Strafanzeigen gegen Wolfgang Albers und Ralf Jäger |trans-title=New Year's Eve mob: 51 criminal complaints against Wolfgang Albers and Ralf Jäger |work=[[Express (Cologne newspaper)|Express]]|language=German|accessdate=18 March 2016}}</ref> <!-- trans-title params checked to this point. See Talk:New_Year%27s_Eve_sexual_assaults_in_Germany#Stop_using_trans-title_in_references. -->
On 25 November 2016, a total of 1,616 crimes was reported for Cologne only. 509 of them were sexually motivated, among them 22 rapes.<ref name="weltnew">[https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article159765841/Wie-es-aussieht-kommen-fast-alle-Taeter-davon.html „Wie es aussieht, kommen fast alle Täter davon“], Die Welt, 25 November 2016, in German</ref>
===Hamburg=== [[File:Dollhouse, Große Freiheit Hamburg.jpg|thumb|Many of the alleged crimes were also committed on the street of [[Große Freiheit]] in [[Hamburg]].]] Similar events took place in [[Hamburg]], specifically on or near [[Reeperbahn]], [[St. Pauli]],<ref name=BBC/> where 53 women reported being sexually assaulted or robbed.<ref name="DPAJan6"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/hamburg/hamburg-mitte/article206889275/Schon-53-Anzeigen-in-Hamburg-nach-Silvester-Uebergriffen.html|title=Schon 53 Anzeigen in Hamburg nach Silvester-Übergriffen|trans-title=Already 53 complaints in Hamburg to New Year's Eve attacks|work=[[Hamburger Abendblatt]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|publisher=The Local|date=6 January 2016|accessdate=24 January 2016|title=Cologne police can't work this way|url=http://www.thelocal.de/20160106/cologne-police-cant-work-this-way-minister}}</ref>
By 7 January, the number of complaints to the police in Hamburg increased to 70,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/hamburg/article206898089/Hamburgs-Nacht-der-Schande-und-das-lange-Schweigen.html|title=Hamburgs Nacht der Schande und das lange Schweigen|trans-title=Hamburg night of shame and the long silence|work=[[Hamburger Abendblatt]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> to 108 by 8 January,<ref name="df"/> to 153 by 12 January,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/hamburg/polizeimeldungen/article206910439/Schuelerin-gekuesst-warum-der-Verdaechtige-noch-frei-ist.html|title=Schülerin geküsst – warum der Verdächtige noch frei ist|trans-title=Schoolgirl kissed - why the suspect is still free|author=Daniel Herder|language=de|accessdate=24 January 2016}}</ref> to 195 by January 14,<ref name="HA2"/> to 205 as of 20 January,<ref name="HA3"/> and to 218 by 21 January. 351 people were reported to be victims of the alleged crimes.<ref name="HA4">{{cite web|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/hamburg/article206951589/Erster-Tatverdaechtiger-nach-Silvester-Uebergriffen-in-Haft.html|title=Erster Tatverdächtiger nach Silvester-Übergriffen in Haft|trans-title=First suspect after New Year's assault in custody|work=[[Hamburger Abendblatt]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> Eight people were identified as suspects, all of them migrants and some recently arrived refugees.<ref name="HA2"/> A first suspect was arrested on January 21.<ref name="HA4"/> According to the police, the number of suspects is likely to rise.<ref name="HA2">{{cite web|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/hamburg/hamburg-mitte/st-pauli/article206925029/Polizei-ermittelt-acht-Tatverdaechtige-nach-Uebergriffen.html|title=Polizei ermittelt acht Tatverdächtige nach Übergriffen|trans-title=Police identified eight suspects after attacks|author=Sascha Balasko|publisher=Hamburger Abendblatt|language=de|accessdate=24 January 2016}}</ref> On 4 February, a Hamburg police report leaked to the press showed that two women have allegedly been raped in Hamburg on New Year's Eve. There were 236 complaints with 391 victims.<ref name="HA5">{{cite web|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/hamburg/hamburg-mitte/st-pauli/article207007549/Silvester-Mob-Aktenzeichen-XY-soll-Hinweise-bringen.html|title=Silvester-Mob: "Aktenzeichen XY" soll Hinweise bringen|trans-title=Silvester - Mob "file number XY" is to bring evidence|work=[[Hamburger Abendblatt]]|accessdate=5 February 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> According to this report, nearly all offences in Hamburg were "exclusively motivated sexually": only three complaints with seven victims in total included no sexual offences.<ref name="HA5"/> Most of the incidents took place around the street of [[Große Freiheit]] near the Reeperbahn, where a large crowd was gathered. Some policemen stood at the entrances of the street, but did not realise that sexual offences were taking place in the crowd or were themselves reluctant to act as they were in the minority. Many women except for one did not even have time or were too upset to call the emergency numbers that night.<ref name="zeit2"/>
Some incidents occurred on a shopping street, [[Jungfernstieg]], where "several hundred" "highly aggressive and intoxicated" migrants threw fire crackers into the crowd. The police described the situation there as "borderline", because only 20 policemen were available there after midnight.<ref name="welt6"/> On the Reeperbahn, bouncers acted to accompany and protect women in reaction to the events, and sales at some clubs and bars fell. On New Year's Eve, doormen were often the only people who could help victims, even those accompanied by husbands or partners.<ref name="zeit2"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/regionales/hamburg/article151026425/Reeperbahn-Bosse-schicken-Tuersteher-auf-Streife.html|title=Nach Silvester-Attacken: Reeperbahn-Bosse schicken Türsteher auf Streife|trans-title=After New Year's Eve attacks: Reeperbahn bosses send bouncer on patrol|author=Geli Tangermann|date=14 January 2016|work=Die Welt|accessdate=24 January 2016|language=de}}</ref> They opened a backyard in which they established a protection zone for the offended women. Doormen described the perpetrators as refugees, which they saw among other characteristics from their mismatching clothes.<ref name="zeit2">{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/2016/03/st-pauli-uebergriffe-silvester-angst|title=Eine Menge Angst|trans-title=A lot of fear|work=[[Die Zeit]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> Mayor [[Olaf Scholz]] demanded quicker deportation of criminal migrants in reaction to the events.<ref name="welt6">{{cite web|author=Olaf Scholz|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/hamburg/polizeimeldungen/article206902439/Olaf-Scholz-Kriminelle-Fluechtlinge-schneller-abschieben.html|title=Kriminelle Flüchtlinge schneller abschieben|trans-title=Deport criminals refugees faster|work=[[Hamburger Abendblatt]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> There has been an increased police presence, especially on the Reeperbahn.<ref name="zeit2"/>
===Other cities=== [[File:Duesseldorf 071022 087 00.jpg|thumb|More than 100 alleged crimes were reported in [[Altstadt (Düsseldorf)|Düsseldorf Downtown]].]] Criminal activity was also reported in [[Bielefeld]], which had 20 complaints; [[Düsseldorf]], which had at least 296 complaints; [[Dortmund]], which had 30 complaints; and [[Stuttgart]], which had at least 72 complaints.<ref name="weltnew"/><ref name="faz"/><ref name="TheGuardJan6">{{cite news|author=Kate Connolly|newspaper=The Guardian|date=6 January 2016|accessdate=7 January 2016|title=Tensions rise in Germany over handling of mass sexual assaults in Cologne|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/jan/06/tensions-rise-in-germany-over-handling-of-mass-sexual-assaults-in-cologne}}</ref><ref name=BBC/><ref name="DPAJan6"/><ref name=BBC3>{{cite news|title=Cologne sex attacks: Merkel disgust at New Year gang assaults|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-35237173|accessdate=5 January 2016|publisher=BBC News|date=5 January 2016}}</ref><ref name="fr">{{cite web|url=http://www.fr-online.de/frankfurt/uebegriffe-an-silvester-weitere-anzeigen-nach-silvesternacht,1472798,33498886.html |title=Weitere Anzeigen nach Silvesternacht |trans-title=Other complaints after New Year's Eve|work=[[Frankfurter Rundschau]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref name="FAZ2"/><ref name="welt10"/>
In Düsseldorf, the 113 complaints of sexual assaults and theft followed 41 others that were reported earlier.<ref name="df">{{dead link|date=November 2018}} {{cite web|url=http://www.deutschlandfunk.de/uebergriffe-an-silvester-108-anzeigen-in-hamburg-41.447.de.html?drn:news_id=567265 |title=108 Anzeigen in Hamburg, 41 Anzeigen in Düsseldorf |trans-title=108 Complaints in Hamburg, 41 in Dusseldorf |work=[[Deutschlandfunk]]|language=German|accessdate=26 January 2016}}</ref><ref name="rpdd">{{cite web|url=http://www.rp-online.de/nrw/staedte/duesseldorf/duesseldorf-mindestens-113-straftaten-in-der-silvesternacht-aid-1.5707342|title=Mindestens 113 Straftaten in der Düsseldorfer Silvesternacht|trans-title=At least 113 crimes in Düsseldorf Silvesternacht|work=[[Rheinische Post]]|accessdate=26 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> The alleged crimes were committed from 11:00 p.m. on New Year's Eve to 6:15 a.m. on 1 January, with a crime being reported every four minutes. Most of the crimes happened in [[Altstadt (Düsseldorf)|Altstadt]], the old town of Düsseldorf.<ref name="rpdd"/> The perpetrators were described as groups of young male migrants who showed "no respect for women".<ref name="welt10"/> 57 of the 113 alleged crimes were sexual assaults, and 13 further were classified as "insulting on a sexual base".<ref name="rpdd"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rp-online.de/polopoly_fs/polizeiprotokoll-der-silvesternacht-in-duesseldorf-1.5707615.1453375000!file/Silvesternacht%20Duesseldorf.pdf|title=Silvesternacht Duesseldorf|work=[[Rheinische Post]]|accessdate=26 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> By November, a total of 296 complaints about 311 crimes were filed in Düsseldorf, in 103 cases there had been a sexual motivation.<ref name="weltnew"/>
In Stuttgart, 17 of the 72 complaints made to the police by 20 January were sexual offences.<ref name="FAZ2">{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/silvesternacht-in-koeln-hatten-die-taten-system-14017964-p2.html|title=Hatten die Taten System?|trans-title=Had the deeds system?|work=[[Frankfurter Allgemeine]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref>
In Dortmund, at least two complaints of sexual assaults were made by 11 January, but the police stated that there are probably more victims. Witnesses told the media of two groups of men, 150 within [[Dortmund Hauptbahnhof|Dortmund main station]], 200{{ndash}}300 outside. One witness described the group in the station as "strangely silent". Another witness stated that the men outside were "aggressive". The victims were then sexually assaulted by smaller groups of men of Arabic or southern origin near the station.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.wdr.de/studio/dortmund/themadestages/sexuelleuebergriffeauchindortmund100.html|title=Dortmunder Polizei sucht Zeugen und Videos|trans-title=Dortmund Police seek witnesses and videos|work=[[Westdeutscher Rundfunk|WDR]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ruhrnachrichten.de/staedte/dortmund/44137-Dortmund~/Polizei-sucht-weitere-Opfer-Silvester-Sexuelle-Belaestigungen-auch-in-Dortmund;art930,2914251|title=Silvester: Sexuelle Belästigungen auch in Dortmund|trans-title=Silvester: Sexual harassment in Dortmund|work=[[Ruhr Nachrichten]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> By 20 January, the number of complaints had risen to 28, including four sexual offences. 32 people were affected in total, seven of them for sexual assaults.<ref name="welt10"/> By November, 30 complaints about 35 crimes were filed in Dortmund.<ref name="weltnew"/>
In [[Bielefeld]], several young women were reported to be sexually assaulted and robbed by men of North African origin in and around a discothèque. Around 500 men tried to force their access into the building. According to witnesses, the doormen pushed back the attackers by using fire extinguishers and tear gas. They also rescued women by pulling them into the building. The perpetrators were reported to be "highly aggressive" "especially against women". At least three complaints of sexual assaults have been made.<ref name="faz"/><ref name="welt9"/><ref name="rp"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nw.de/lokal/bielefeld/mitte/mitte/20674877_Boulevard-Erschreckender-Bericht-eines-Tuerstehers-zu-den-Silvestervorgaengen.html|title=Erschreckender Bericht eines Türstehers zu den Silvestervorgängen|trans-title=Terrifying report of a doorman at the New Year's Eve events|work=[[Neue Westfälische]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> By 20 January, the number of the complaints rose to 18, five of which included sexual assaults. There were 22 victims in total in Bielefeld.<ref name="welt10">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/regionales/nrw/article151245631/Nach-Silvester-fast-1000-Anzeigen-in-vier-Staedten.html |title=Nach Silvester fast 1000 Anzeigen in vier Städten |trans-title=After New Year nearly 1,000 complaints filed in four cities|work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=26 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> By November, there were 20 complaints in Bielefeld.<ref name="weltnew"/>
On 20 January, [[North Rhine-Westphalia Police]] published provisional figures for the four cities in its territory: [[Bielefeld]], [[Cologne]], Dortmund, and Düsseldorf. There were complaints of nearly 1,000 crimes with a total of 1,216 victims from the four cities alone.<ref name="nrw">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/regionales/nrw/article151138995/Rund-1000-Silvester-Straftaten-in-vier-NRW-Grossstaedten.html|title=Rund 1000 Silvester-Straftaten in vier NRW-Großstädten|trans-title=Around 1000 New Year's crimes in four NRW cities|work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> By 9 April, these numbers had risen to 1,754 crimes, with 1,455 victims living in all four cities.<ref name="nrw2">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/regionales/nrw/article154154836/Was-die-zaehe-Aufklaerung-der-Silvesternacht-offenbart.html|title=Was die zähe Aufklärung der Silvesternacht offenbart|trans-title=What reveals the tough Enlightenment's Eve|work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=9 April 2016|language=German}}</ref> Also in January, the fact became known from a confidential report of the German ''[[Federal Criminal Police Office (Germany)|Bundeskriminalamt]]'' (Federal Criminal Office, BKA) that offences similar to those in North Rhine-Westphalia and Hamburg occurred—in a lower extent—in 12 of the 16 German federal states.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/panorama/polizei-bka-bericht-silvester-uebergriffe-in-zwoelf-bundeslaendern-1.2831374|title=BKA: Silvester-Übergriffe in zwölf Bundesländern|trans-title=BKA: New Year's Eve attacks in twelve provinces|work=[[Süddeutsche Zeitung]]|language=German|accessdate=18 March 2016}}</ref>
In addition, similar assaults in [[Austria]], [[Finland]], [[Switzerland]], and [[Sweden]] were reported.<ref name=OtherCountries1>{{cite web|title=New Year's Eve sex assaults also reported in Finland, Switzerland and Austria|url=http://www.news.com.au/world/europe/new-years-eve-sex-assaults-also-reported-in-finland-sweden-and-austria/news-story/ce603ac27e5ebb4479874096fe299b97|publisher=News Corp Australia Network|accessdate=8 January 2016}}</ref><ref name=Sweden_G&M>{{cite web|title=Swedish women report being groped by men on New Year's Eve|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/swedish-women-report-being-groped-by-men-on-new-years-eve/article28071818/|website=The Globe and Mail|publisher=The Globe and Mail, Inc.|accessdate=24 January 2016}}</ref>
==Police response== <!-- [[File:Neujahr 2016 Polizei NRW Twitter.png|thumb|Cologne police Twitter post describing atmosphere as "playful" on New Year's morning]] --> {{tweet |text=#polizei #köln #leverkusen Ausgelassene Stimmung - Feiern weitgehend friedlich - Infos unter https://www.presseportal.de/blaulicht/pm/12415/3214905 |name=Polizei NRW K |username=polizei_nrw_k |date =1 Jan 2016 |ID=682875312095539200 |lang=de |translation=#police #cologne #leverkusen Exuberant Mood - Celebrations largely peaceful - Info at https://www.presseportal.de/blaulicht/pm/12415/3214905 }}
In Cologne, police dispatched 143 local officers and 70 federal officers to restore order. However, due to the darkness and the number of people involved, police chief [[Wolfgang Albers (police president)|Wolfgang Albers]] conceded that their efforts were not effective.<ref name=local/> In March, media outlets reported that there were not 143, but only 80 police officers deployed at the central station, the others being in service elsewhere in downtown Cologne. Also, the number of policemen at the station was reduced later that night, as there were further police operations in the city. A police spokesman said that the corrected number had been transmitted to the Parliamentary Committee of the Interior on 11 January. However, he could not explain why it hadn't been published earlier.<ref name="szg">{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/panorama/nach-den-uebergriffen-in-koeln-silvesternacht-in-koeln-offenbar-waren-viel-weniger-polizisten-im-einsatz-als-gedacht-1.2911408|title=Silvesternacht in Köln: Offenbar viel weniger Polizisten im Einsatz als gedacht|trans-title=Silvesternacht in Köln: Offenbar viel weniger Polizisten im Einsatz als gedacht|work=[[Süddeutsche Zeitung]]|language=German|accessdate=18 March 2016}}</ref>
Cologne police came under criticism for their handling of the situation, as their initial press release described the New Year's Eve celebrations as "playful". Days later, the German [[Federal Criminal Police Office (Germany)|Federal Criminal Police Office]] said the incidents were, "A phenomenon known in some [[Arab World|Arab countries]] as ''taharrush jamai''" (translated as "group sexual harassment").<ref name="welt3"/><ref name="bbc11.01.2016">{{cite news|last=Staff|title=Cologne attackers were of migrant origin - minister|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-35280386|work=[[BBC News]]|publisher=[[BBC]]|date=11 January 2016|accessdate=24 January 2016}}</ref><ref name="bbc15.02.2013">{{cite news|last=Maqbool|title=Why are sex attacks on the rise in Tahrir Square?|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-21441624|work=[[BBC News]]|publisher=[[BBC]]|date=15 February 2013|accessdate=25 July 2016}}</ref> However, this is not an accepted cultural practice in the Arab world<ref name="huff1"/>
One victim who was robbed and assaulted was told to report the incident elsewhere by the police.<ref name=DW/> Interior Minister [[Thomas de Maizière]] also criticized the [[North Rhine-Westphalia]] police for describing the celebrations as "peaceful".<ref name=DW2/> Police chief Wolfgang Albers later called the assaults "a completely new dimension of crime".<ref name=BBC3/>
Düsseldorf police told reporters they were investigating whether the attacks in Cologne were linked to a gang of roughly 2,000 North African men, a known criminal network in Düsseldorf.<ref name="DPAJan6">{{cite web|publisher=Deutsche Presse-Agentur|date=6 January 2016|accessdate=7 January 2016|title=Police investigate organized crime ring's links to Cologne attacks|url=http://www.dpa-international.com/news/international/police-investigating-organized-crime-rings-links-to-cologne-attacks-a-47829553.html|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160110212623/http://www.dpa-international.com/news/international/police-investigating-organized-crime-rings-links-to-cologne-attacks-a-47829553.html|archivedate=10 January 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|agency=Associated Press|publisher=CBS News|date=6 January 2016|accessdate=24 January 2016|title=Germany sex assaults could be linked to criminal gang|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/germany-police-cologne-sexual-assaults-criminal-network-refugees-migrants|location=Cologne, Germany}}</ref>
On 7 January, the police acknowledged an information blackout until the interior committee of the parliament of North Rhine-Westphalia discussed the events on 11 January. That same day, a report by a leading police officer in Cologne on New Year's Eve was cited in several newspapers, including criticism that the number of police officers was too small to deal with the events.<ref name="ds"/> According to the report, the perpetrators acted "with a disrespect I didn't see in 29 years of service." Some shouted, "I am Syrian! You have to treat me friendly. Mrs [[Angela Merkel|Merkel]] has invited me!" Others tore their immigration papers while saying, "You can't do me anything. Tomorrow I will go and get new papers."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article150729450/Das-Protokoll-zur-Koelner-Chaos-Nacht-zum-Nachlesen.html|title=Das Protokoll zur Kölner Chaos-Nacht zum Nachlesen|trans-title=The Protocol Cologne Chaos Nights for future reference|work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> Because of the allegations of misinformation and the "loss of public trust", Albers was transferred to provisional retirement for his handling of the situation on 8 January.<ref name="IBTimes">{{cite news|title=Cologne sex attacks: Police chief Wolfgang Albers 'sacked' following heavy criticism|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/cologne-sex-attacks-police-chief-wolfgang-albers-sacked-following-heavy-criticism-1536891|work=International Business Times|accessdate=12 January 2016}}</ref><ref name="spiegel.de">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/koeln-ralf-jaeger-versetzt-polizeipraesident-albers-in-ruhestand-a-1071134.html|title=Einsatz in der Silvesternacht: Kölns Polizeipräsident in einstweiligen Ruhestand versetzt|trans-title=Offset Cologne Police President in hiatus: use in the New Year's Eve|work=[[Der Spiegel]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref>
The German [[Federal Criminal Police Office (Germany)|Federal Criminal Police Office]] (Bundeskriminalamt, BKA) stated on 9 January that the incidents of collective sexual harassment were a phenomenon known in Arab countries as "''taharrush gamea''" ("communal sexual harassment"). The BKA announced their intention to investigate the facts about such incidents in all German federal states and learn how to combat them.<ref name="welt3">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article150813517/Das-Phaenomen-taharrush-gamea-ist-in-Deutschland-angekommen.html|title=Sexuelle Belästigung: Das Phänomen "taharrush gamea" ist in Deutschland angekommen|trans-title=Sexual Harassment: The phenomenon "taharrush gameâ" has arrived in Germany|author=Martin Lutz|date=10 January 2016|work=Die Welt|accessdate=24 January 2016|language=de}}</ref>
On 15 January, the Cologne police offered a reward of 10,000 [[euro]] for relevant information leading to the identification of an offender. The posters were hung up near airports, railway stations, and refugees' residences.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/politik/videos/nach-silvesternacht-in-koeln-auf-deutsch-und-arabisch-polizei-sucht-mit-fahndungsplakat-nach-taetern_id_5215077.html|title=10.000 Euro Belohnung ausgesetzt: Polizei sucht mit Fahndungsplakat nach Tätern|trans-title=Exposed to 10,000 Euro reward: Police seek offenders with wanted posters|work=[[Focus (German magazine)|Focus]]|accessdate=26 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> In Hamburg, 2,000 euro were offered as a reward.<ref name="HA5"/>
In reaction to the events at Cologne, the North Rhine-Westfalia police conducted several raids in refugee accommodations all over its territory in the following days to increase pressure on criminal migrants. Among others, raids were conducted in [[Recklinghausen]], where the perpetrator of [[January 2016 Paris police station attack|a January 2016 attempted attack]] at a police station in [[Paris]] lived before committing that crime. Further raids were reported from [[Kalk, Cologne]]; and [[Ahlen]]. In Ahlen, only 144 of 230 registered persons were found during the raid; the others had fled. Around 50 percent of those present lived under false identities. The police opened 86 criminal proceedings for illegal residence, drug crimes, abuse of social benefits, and personal injury.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article151372514/Polizei-NRW-erhoeht-Druck-auf-kriminelle-Asylbewerber.html|title=Polizei NRW erhöht Druck auf kriminelle Asylbewerber|trans-title=NRW police increased pressure on criminal asylum seekers|work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=26 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref>
Cologne police stepped up police presence at [[Cologne Carnival]] in reaction to the incidents. More than 2,500 security forces were deployed, more than three times the amount of forces utilized in the previous year.<ref name="kr"/> Cologne police also kept sexual assault suspects out of the Carnival celebrations with entry bans.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.wdr.de/themen/infokompakt/nachrichten/nrwkompakt/karneval-polizei-zutrittsverbote-koeln-100.html|title=Kölner Polizei schließt Tatverdächtige vom Karneval aus|trans-title=Cologne police exclude suspects from Carnival|work=[[Westdeutscher Rundfunk|WDR]]|accessdate=31 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> An all-girls high school in Cologne was closed at Carnival, while others addressed the incidents in class and informed their pupils about preventive measures.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/vermischtes/article151665766/Gymnasium-gibt-Schuelerinnen-Karneval-frei-zur-Sicherheit.html|title=Gymnasium gibt Schülerinnen Karneval frei – zur Sicherheit|trans-title=School gives students carnival dates - for safety|work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=31 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> Nevertheless, on 5 February, [[New Year's Eve sexual assaults in Germany#Sexual offences at Carnival|three rapes]] were reported, at least two of them by migrants.<ref name="fa"/>
==Suspects and detainees==
===Cologne=== [[File:Aussetzen einer Belohnung Verbrechen in der Silvesternacht 2015-2016 Köln -4597.jpg|thumb|Poster showing the title "Offering a Reward" in both German and Arabic in Cologne.]] There were conflicting reports about the number of detainees. According to initial reports by the [[BBC]], eight suspects, all asylum seekers, were detained in Cologne, though no official statement on their involvement was made.<ref name="BBC"/> Further reports said that five men from the ages of 18 to 24 were arrested, although they were later found to have committed unrelated crimes.<ref name="DPAJan6"/> Reports made on 7 January suggested that police officials detained more people (namely asylum seekers) on New Year's Eve than they admitted publicly.<ref name="welt"/> According to a police report leaked to the media, there were 71 people controlled, of whom 11 were arrested, and four taken into custody. As of 7 January, the police of Cologne only officially confirmed there were 16 suspects.<ref name="bild">{{cite web|url=http://www.bild.de/news/inland/sexuelle-noetigung/mutmassliche-taeter-waren-asylbewerber-44060872.bild.html|title=Das verschwieg uns die Kölner Polizei|trans-title=The Cologne police concealed us|work=[[Bild]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref>
On 8 January, Cologne Police announced the arrest of two suspects in connection with the attacks. They were identified—in keeping with German privacy law—as Issam D., a 16-year-old [[Morocco|Moroccan]]; and Mohamed T., a 23-year-old [[Tunisia]]n. Both were said to be asylum seekers. The police reported that they found video footage of assaults on New Year's Eve on their mobile phones. The suspects were also found in possession of a piece of paper with Arabic-German translations of derogatory sexual terms and phrases including "I want sex with you" and "I will kill you".<ref name="Spiegel">{{cite web|publisher=Der Spiegel|date=8 January 2016|accessdate=8 January 2016|title=Übergriffe an Silvester: Kölner Polizei nimmt zwei Verdächtige fest|trans-title=Assaults on New Year's Eve: Cologne police arrest two suspects|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/koelner-polizei-nimmt-nach-uebergriffen-zwei-verdaechtige-fest-a-1071100.html}}</ref> Both of them were set free shortly after their arrest.<ref name="WDR">{{cite web|publisher=Westdeutscher Rundfunk|date=10 January 2016|accessdate=10 January 2016|title=Festgenommene wieder auf freiem Fuß|trans-title=Arrested again on the loose|url=http://www1.wdr.de/themen/aktuell/festnahmen-koeln-102.html|language=de}}</ref>
As of 8 January, federal police had identified 31 suspects, among whom were 18 identified asylum seekers. Of these, 17 were said by the Interior Ministry to be from [[Algeria]] or [[Morocco]]. Two Germans and one [[U.S. citizen]] were among the suspects identified.<ref name=Troianovski>{{cite news|author=Anton Troianovski|title=Germany Says Asylum Seekers Among Suspects in Cologne New Year's Eve Assaults|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/germany-says-asylum-seekers-among-suspects-in-cologne-new-years-eve-assaults-1452253734|accessdate=24 January 2016|publisher=[[New York Times]]|date=8 January 2016}}</ref> An additional 19 suspects were later identified by Cologne's police as being "almost exclusively" migrants. Of the 19 suspects identified on 11 January, 14 were men from Morocco and Algeria. Ten of the 19 were asylum seekers, nine of whom had arrived in Germany after September 2015; the other nine suspects may have been residing in the country illegally.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-35280386|title=Cologne attackers were of migrant origin - minister|work=BBC News|accessdate=24 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mik.nrw.de/fileadmin/user_upload/Redakteure/Dokumente/Themen_und_Aufgaben/Schutz_und_Sicherheit/160111ssia/160111berichtmik.pdf|title=Bericht des Ministeriums für Inneres und Kommunales über die Übergriffe am Hauptbahnhof Köln in der Silvesternacht|trans-title= Report of the Ministry of Home Affairs and Local about the attacks on Cologne Central Station in New Year's Eve|work=mik.nrw.de|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> The number of identified suspects had risen to 23 by 12 January. The department of public prosecution opened criminal proceedings against 13 people, five of whom were in detention at that time.<ref name="welt2">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article150765894/Verdaechtige-Maenner-hatten-Sex-Spickzettel-dabei.html |title=Verdächtige Männer hatten Sex-Spickzettel dabei |trans-title=Male suspects had sex-phrase cheat sheets with them |work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}</ref><ref name="welt4"/><ref name="sz"/><ref name="spiegel"/><ref name="spiegel3"/>
On 19 January, it was reported that there was a first arrest because of allegations of sexual offences. The detainee was a 26-year old Algerian who was living in an refugee camp in [[Kerpen]]. He was arrested on the last weekend along with a fellow countryman who was accused of theft.<ref name="welt7"/> By 21 January, there were 30 suspects for the Cologne incidents, 25 of whom were of Moroccan or Algerian origin. Fifteen of the 30 were asylum seekers, two underage unaccompanied refugees. Eight people were in investigative custody.<ref name="ds3"/><ref name="focus2"/>
On 29 January, it was reported that a further suspect, a man from Algeria, was arrested due to property offence and resistance against enforcement officers. Criminal investigations in Cologne were conducted against 44 people, North Africans by majority, ten of whom were in investigative custody as of 29 January.<ref name="waz">{{cite web|url=https://www.derwesten.de/region/staatsanwaltschaft-koeln-mehr-als-1000-anzeigen-id11507959.html |title=Staatsanwaltschaft Köln: Mehr als 1000 Anzeigen |trans-title=Cologne Prosecutor's Office: More than 1000 criminal complaints |work=[[Westdeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung]]|accessdate=31 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> The number of identified suspects in Cologne was 73 by 15 February, with 15 of them being in investigative custody.<ref name="waz2"/><ref name="ds4"/> A large majority of the suspects were from Algeria and Morocco. 30 Moroccans, 27 Algerians, and three Tunisians were among the suspects, along with a [[Libya]]n, an [[Iran]]ian, four [[Iraq]]is, a [[Montenegrins|Montenegrin]], three Syrians, and three Germans.<ref name="waz2"/> By 17 March, the number of suspects had again risen to 120, 14 of whom were in investigative custody.<ref name="szg"/> By 6 April, the number of suspects in Cologne was 153, 149 of whom were non-Germans; 103 of the 153 suspects were from [[Morocco]] or [[Algeria]]. Sixty-eight persons were asylum seekers; 18 were residing in Germany illegally, and the legal status of 47 persons was unclear. Four persons were underage, unaccompanied refugees.<ref name="spi"/>
On 24 February, a first suspect, a 23-year-old Moroccan was sentenced to a penalty of six months on probation for stealing a cellphone from a woman as she was taking a picture of the [[Cologne Cathedral]] on New Year's Eve and also for carrying a small amount of drugs. Criminal proceedings were also taking place against two other men from Tunisia and Algeria.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/urteil-bewaehrungsstrafe-fuer-ersten-angeklagten-der-koelner-silvesternacht-14087803.html|title=Bewährungsstrafe für ersten Angeklagten der Kölner Silvesternacht|trans-title=Probation for first accused of Cologne New Year's Eve attacks|work=[[Frankfurter Allgemeine]]|language=German|accessdate=24 February 2016}}</ref>
Another suspect in Cologne, identified only as Mehdi E.-B., a 19-year-old asylum seeker from Morocco, was recognized by victims, including a female student, in a TV report of ''[[Spiegel TV]]''. Along with seven alleged accomplices, he was accused of sexual assaulting the victims out of a group. When the police attempted to detain the men, conducting raids in Cologne, [[Hamm]], [[Troisdorf]], and [[Bornheim (Rheinland)|Bornheim]] on 18 February, they had already fled. Mehdi E.-B. was reported to have lived under a false identity at first, according to witnesses. The janitor of the migrant's residence said he had "stolen like a raven". In one residence, 20 cellphones were found, one of which had been stolen on New Year's Eve. Mehdi E.-B. was already sentenced for stealing a cellphone together with a man identified only as Otman K. in January 2016. Otman K. was suspected of being a member of the same group of accused sexual assailants as Mehdi E.-B.<ref name="ds5">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/silvester-in-koeln-mutmasslicher-taeter-taucht-unter-a-1078459.html|title=Mutmaßlicher Silvester-Täter: Auf und davon|trans-title=Alleged perpetrators Silvester: Hit|work=[[Der Spiegel]]|language=German|accessdate=24 February 2016}}</ref>
On 8 March, for the first time, Cologne police published photos of wanted men who are suspected in the New Year's Eve assaults. The photos were partly taken from victims who managed to take pictures of their assailants. In total, the police evaluated 1,100 hours of video footage taken from CCTV cameras and witnesses. A police spokesman explained that the sophisticated work that it took to link the men in the footage to specific crimes was a reason behind the late publishing. The next day, two of the wanted men were put under investigative custody. A 26-year-old man was arrested in [[Kerpen]], while a 31-year-old man from Algeria turned himself in to the police in [[Hamm]]. On March 9, police released further photos, one showing a man firing a weapon into the air; officials clarified that no one was injured by the gunshot.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/inland/silvesternacht-in-koeln-polizei-nimmt-verdaechtige-von-fahndungsfotos-fest-14114725.html|title=Polizei nimmt Verdächtige von Fahndungsfotos fest|trans-title=Police arrest suspect of mugshots|work=[[Frankfurter Allgemeine]]|language=German|accessdate=9 March 2016}}</ref>
On 28 April, a 19-year-old Moroccan and a 24-year-old person were arrested in northern [[Switzerland]]. The Moroccan was one of the suspects in the Cologne assaults, and had applied for asylum in Switzerland.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/sexual-assaults_cologne-attack-suspect-arrested-in-switzerland/42120916|title=Cologne attack suspect extradited from Switzerland|work=Swissinfo|date=29 April 2016|accessdate=29 April 2016}}</ref>
On 25 November, it was reported that in 369 of the 509 crime cases, which were sexually motivated, no perpetrators could be identified. The prosecutor's office could initiate 58 criminal investigations against 83 persons. Only 6 were convicted so far. The highest sentence was 1 year and 9 month due to sexual assault and robbery. 52 of the accused men had to be acquitted due to lack of unanimous identification. The investigators failed to convict more of the perpetrators because the vicinity of the station was "dark and overcrowded" and the CCTV recordings were of "miserable" quality.<ref name="weltnew"/>
===Other cities=== In [[Düsseldorf]], initially nine persons were named as suspects, eight of whom are migrants.<ref name="welt10"/> According to a media report, an 18-year-old woman from [[Mönchengladbach]] recognized a perpetrator in a report of ''[[Spiegel TV]]'' and decided to make a complaint to the police afterwards. The 33-year-old man, who is suspected to have sexually offended the woman in Düsseldorf out of a group, was arrested by investigators.<ref name="ds4">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/koelner-silvester-uebergriffe-polizei-ermittelt-gegen-73-verdaechtige-a-1077503.html|title=Übergriffe in der Silvesternacht: Kölner Polizei ermittelt gegen 73 Verdächtige|trans-title=Attacks in New Year's Eve: Cologne police investigating 73 suspects|work=[[Der Spiegel]]|language=German|accessdate=15 February 2016}}</ref> In [[Dortmund]], nine further people were put under suspicion, seven of them migrants.<ref name="welt10"/> In [[Bielefeld]], four migrants from Morocco and Algeria were identified as suspects.<ref name="welt10"/> By 20 January, the [[North Rhine-Westphalia Police]], responsible for [[Bielefeld]], [[Cologne]], Dortmund, and Düsseldorf, reported that 52 people were being treated as suspects; a majority of them were of non-German origin.<ref name="nrw"/> In Düsseldorf, in 62 of the 103 sexually motivated crimes no suspect could be identified by November. One of the Düsseldorf perpetrators was sentenced to one year and 10 month in prison. Criminal proceedings against two further men are in progress.<ref name="weltnew"/> In Bielefeld, in five of the 20 cases no perpetrator could be identified by November.<ref name="weltnew"/> In Dortmund, by November, two men were convicted because of sexual assaults, one received a financial penalty, the other was sentenced to 25 hours of community service.<ref name="weltnew"/>
Eight people were named as suspects in [[Hamburg]], all of them migrants and some of them refugees.<ref name="HA2"/> On 20 January, Hamburg police published photos of two wanted persons who are suspected to have sexually assaulted an 18-year-old girl in the early morning hours of 1 January on the street of [[Große Freiheit]],<ref name="HA3">{{cite web|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/nachrichten/article206943905/Silvester-Uebergriffe-Polizei-sucht-nach-diesen-Verdaechtigen.html|title=Silvester-Übergriffe: Polizei sucht nach diesen Verdächtigen|trans-title=New Year's Eve attacks: Police are searching for these suspects|work=[[Hamburger Abendblatt]]|language=German|accessdate=30 January 2016}}</ref> which led to the arrest of a 29-year-old male migrant from [[Afghanistan]] on 21 January. He was recognised by a security guard of a refugee reception center in Hamburg. A second suspected migrant was freed shortly after his arrest due to a lack of adequate suspicion.<ref name="HA4"/> On 26 January, Hamburg police published another photo of a wanted person, who is suspected to have sexually assaulted two 20-year-old women on New Year's Eve while acting as part of a group.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/hamburg/hamburg-mitte/article206968755/Polizei-sucht-Mann-wegen-sexueller-Noetigung-an-Silvester.html|title=Polizei sucht Mann wegen sexueller Nötigung an Silvester|trans-title=Police seek man for sexual assault on New Year's Eve|work=[[Hamburger Abendblatt]]|accessdate=30 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> On 5 February, a 33-year-old man from [[Iran]] was reported to have been arrested in a refugee reception center in Hamburg and taken into investigative custody under suspicion of assaulting the two women in Hamburg.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/regional/hamburg/kriminalitaet-haftbefehl-nach-sexueller-noetigung-in-der-silvesternacht_id_5264931.html|title=Auf Überwachungsfoto identifiziert: Polizei verhaftet Sex-Täter|trans-title=Identified on surveillance photo: Police arrest sex offenders|work=[[Focus (German magazine)|Focus]]|accessdate=7 February 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/hamburg/article207011161/Polizei-nimmt-weiteren-Tatverdaechtigen-fest.html|title=Polizei nimmt weiteren Tatverdächtigen fest|trans-title=Police arrest another suspect|work=[[Hamburger Abendblatt]]|accessdate=7 February 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> On 4 February, Hamburg police released photos of two further suspects. The nationwide TV series ''[[Aktenzeichen XY … ungelöst]]'' was used for the manhunt for the Hamburg perpetrators.<ref name="HA5"/>
In [[Stuttgart]], a 20-year-old asylum seeker from [[Iraq]] was detained for sexually assaulting two girls while acting out of a group.<ref name="FAZ2"/> In [[Frankfurt]], the police is investigating ten men in the ages of 15 to 27, all asylum seekers or refugees, who were temporarily arrested for pickpocketing on New Year's Eve near the bridge of [[Eiserner Steg]]. They are trying to determine if these men were involved in the sexual assaults. One of the suspects is in investigative custody.<ref name="fr"/>
[[Reinhard Merkel]], a law professor from Hamburg, said that convicting the suspects, especially for sexual offences, will be difficult because an unequivocal identification by the victims is needed, which is often not the case. Furthermore, policemen stated that the video footage of the cameras within and outside the Cologne main station is partly unusable.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/inland/ermittlungen-nach-koeln-ich-nehme-nicht-an-dass-die-taeter-verurteilt-werden-koennen-14020264.html|title=Ich nehme nicht an, dass die Täter verurteilt werden können|trans-title=I do not suppose that the offender can be sentenced|work=[[Frankfurter Allgemeine]]|accessdate=24 January 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref>
=== Dispute over definition of 'refugee' === By mid-February 2016, 73 suspects of criminal offences during Cologne's New Year's Night 2015/2016 had been identified of whom 58 had been arrested.The 73 consisted of 30 Moroccans, 27 Algerians, 4 Iraqis, 3 Tunisians, 3 Syrians, 3 Germans, and one each from Libya, Iran and Montenegro. While certain news outlets and campaigners considered only the arrested suspects coming from Syria or Iraq as "[[refugees]]", they had concluded that only three of the 58 arrested suspects were "refugees".<ref name="gutteridge"/><ref name="prosecutor"/><br>In reaction, Cologne's chief prosecutor Bremer angrily retorted that "the overwhelming majority" of the 73 suspected men were either [[asylum seeker]], [[Asylum seeker|asylum applicant]], or [[Illegal immigration|illegal immigrant]], which ''he'' all considered to "fall into the general category of [[refugee]]s".<ref name="gutteridge">{{cite news |author=Nick Gutteridge |date=19 February 2016 |title=Cologne rapists were refugees |url=http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/644379/Cologne-attacks-German-prosector-New-Years-Eve-rapists-migrants-refugees |newspaper=[[Daily Express]] |accessdate=24 July 2018}}</ref><ref name="prosecutor">{{dead link|date= July 2018}} {{cite web |date=15 February 2016 |title=Prosecutor: Most Cologne New Year's suspects are refugees |url=https://news.yahoo.com/cologne-prosecutor-majority-suspects-asylum-seekers-135156726.html |work=[[Associated Press]] |accessdate=17 February 2016}}</ref>
==Similar incidents==
===Germany=== At [[Karneval der Kulturen]] (''Carnival of Cultures'') festival in [[Kreuzberg]], [[Berlin]], on [[Pentecost]] weekend, twelve similar crimes were reported, eight of which were sexual assaults. Seven men of Tunisian, Moroccan, Libyan, and Algerian origin were arrested on charges of theft. Four further men were arrested under allegations of sexual assault. The press reported the case of two teenage girls, ages 17 and 18, who were encircled and molested by a group of ten young men. According to the police, the suspects of these sexual assaults had a Turkish and Lebanese "migration background". In addition, a 16-year-old girl and a 22-year-old woman were sexually assaulted. In the case of the 22-year-old victim, a 40-year-old man from Turkey was arrested as a suspect.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesspiegel.de/berlin/uebergriffe-beim-karneval-der-kulturen-zahl-der-antaenzer-deutlich-hoeher-als-bisher-bekannt/13603758.html|title=Zahl der "Antänzer" deutlich höher als bisher bekannt|trans-title=Number of "Antänzer" significantly higher than previously known|work=[[Der Tagesspiegel]]|accessdate=30 May 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> On 30 May, it was reported that a total of 18 complaints were made to the police after the music festival of ''Schlossgrabenfest'' in [[Darmstadt]]. Like the Karneval der Kulturen case, women were encircled by groups of young men. Three suspected asylum seekers, ages 28 to 31, were arrested, and additional suspects are being sought by the police.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/rhein-main/uebergriffe-auf-schlossgartenfest-in-darmstadt-14260871.html|title=Frauen bei Schlossgrabenfest sexuell belästigt|trans-title=Sexually harassed women at Castle grave hard|work=[[Frankfurter Allgemeine]]|accessdate=30 May 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> On 17 August, ''[[Frankfurter Allgemeine]]'' reported that the number of sexual assaults on public festivals in the state of [[Hesse]] is greater than officially known and organizers of such events are at the boundaries of what's possible in order to protect the visitors. Further sexual assaults by migrants were reported from public festivals in [[Wolfhagen]] and [[Herborn, Hesse|Herborn]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/rhein-main/mehr-sexuelle-uebergriffe-als-bisher-bekannt-14391678.html|title=Mehr Übergriffe als bisher bekannt|trans-title=More attacks than previously known|work=Frankfurter Allgemeine|date=17 August 2016|language=German}}</ref>
On 28 October, similar sexual assaults by asylum seekers from [[Gambia]] were reported in the city of [[Freiburg im Breisgau|Freiburg]]. Two women were assaulted by a total of 17 men who encircled and molested them on the square of Stühlinger Kirchplatz. A passerby intervened, but was attacked by the group. The police arrested three main suspects, all ages 17, 19, and 20. The victims identified them unequivocally.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.n-tv.de/panorama/Zwei-Frauen-von-17-Maennern-belaestigt-article18952421.html|title=Zwei Frauen von 17 Männern belästigt|trans-title=Two women molested by 17 men|work=n-tv.de|date=28 October 2016|accessdate=29 October 2016|language=German}}</ref> Previously, on 4 July, an attempted rape by an asylum seeker from [[Sub-Saharan Africa]], who was arrested the same night, was reported from a discothèque, ''White Rabbit'' in Freiburg. In January, refugees had been banned from some discothèques in Freiburg after a similar case had taken place, but they were eventually allowed to reenter the ''White Rabbit'' discothèque with a special ID card following protests.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.badische-zeitung.de/freiburg/versuchte-vergewaltigung-in-freiburger-diskothek-white-rabbit--124394196.html|title=Versuchte Vergewaltigung in Freiburger Diskothek White Rabbit|trans-title=Attempted rape in Freiburg Disco White Rabbit|work=Badische Zeitung|date=4 July 2016|accessdate=29 October 2016|language=German}}</ref> On 19 October, ''[[Der Spiegel]]'' reported sexual assaults by migrants in the [[Leipzig]] cultural center ''Conne Island''. Initially, refugees were allowed to enter the center on a low price, but after several cases of sexual assaults were reported by women, the integration project was stopped and a registration by e-mail is now necessary for migrants to enter.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/gesellschaft/leipzig-conne-island-macht-sexuelle-uebergriffe-von-fluechtlingen-oeffentlich-a-1117198.html|title=Warum Leipziger Linke ein Integrationsprojekt stoppten|trans-title=Why Leipziger left stopped an integration project|work=Der Spiegel|date=19 October 2016|accessdate=29 October 2016|language=German}}</ref>
====Sexual offences at Carnival==== At least three rapes were reported at the [[Cologne Carnival]]. A 17-year-old asylum seeker from [[Afghanistan]] was suspected of raping a 22-year-old woman and a teenager was subsequently arrested at a residence for refugees.<ref name="foc">{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/regional/karneval/karneval-2016-weiberfastnacht-sexualdelikte-und-schlaegereien-das-ist-die-bilanz-der-polizei_id_5263194.html|title=Weiberfastnacht: Frau nachts niedergeschlagen und vergewaltigt - das ist das Fazit der Polizei|trans-title=Weiberfastnacht: woman knocked down at night and raped - this is the conclusion of the police|work=[[Focus (German magazine)|Focus]]|accessdate=5 February 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> The suspect was released the following day, but another 17-year-old male from the same accommodation was then arrested.<ref name="welt12">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/vermischtes/article151906037/Grapscher-stellt-sich-begleitet-von-seiner-Mutter.html|title=Grapscher stellt sich – begleitet von seiner Mutter|trans-title=Grapscher arises - accompanied by his mother|work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=7 February 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> A second rape was also reported in Cologne.<ref name="fa">{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/gesellschaft/kriminalitaet/karneval-in-koeln-drei-vergewaltigungen-nach-weiberfastnacht-angezeigt-14054862.html|title=Drei Vergewaltigungen nach Weiberfastnacht angezeigt|trans-title=Complaints about three rapes after Weiberfastnacht|work=[[Frankfurter Allgemeine]]|accessdate=7 February 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> At Carnival celebrations in [[Schloß Holte-Stukenbrock|Stukenbrock]] in the district of [[Gütersloh (district)|Gütersloh]], a third rape was reported. A 29-year-old asylum seeker from [[Nigeria]] was strongly suspected to have raped a 24-year-old woman and was arrested.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/regional/karneval/polizei-verhaftet-zuwanderer-aus-afrika-mann-vergewaltigt-24-jaehrige-frau-beim-strassenkarneval_id_5263265.html|title=Mann vergewaltigt 24-jährige Frau beim Straßenkarneval|trans-title=Man raped 24-year-old woman at the street carnival|work=[[Focus (German magazine)|Focus]]|accessdate=5 February 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref>
A total of 224 complaints were made to the police so far in Cologne. They consisted mostly of personal injuries, but also included 22 sexual offences.<ref name="foc" /><ref name="spieg">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/weiberfastnacht-koelner-polizei-nimmt-in-karnevalsnacht-mehr-als-200-anzeigen-auf-a-1075802.html |title=Weiberfastnacht: Kölner Polizei nimmt mehr als 200 Anzeigen auf |trans-title=Cologne Festival Women's Night: Cologne police accept more than 200 criminal complaints |work=[[Der Spiegel]]|accessdate=5 February 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> By 10 February, the number of sexual offences in Cologne at Carnival had risen to 66.<ref name="welt14" /> 99 persons were detained in Cologne on Carnival, while 432 others were arrested temporarily.<ref name="welt14" /><ref name="welt13" /> A total of 1,389 people were dismissed from Carnival celebrations by the police.<ref name="welt14" />
Jürgen Mathies, the new police chief of Cologne, said this was "much", but it had something to do with the fact "that the police intervened very consistently this time."<ref name="welt13">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article152009450/So-erklaert-der-Polizeipraesident-die-vielen-Festnahmen.html|title=So erklärt der Polizeipräsident die vielen Festnahmen|trans-title=So says the chief of police the many arrests|work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=9 February 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref> Nevertheless, Mathies stated that there had been a "highly problematic clientele": groups from Northern Africa, which converged on the stairways in front of the [[Cologne Cathedral]]. The police had to deploy additional forces on 7 February, and the security situation at Carnival was tense.<ref name="welt14">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article152083296/Hochproblematisches-Klientel-auf-der-Domtreppe.html|title=Hochproblematisches Klientel auf der Domtreppe|trans-title=High problematic clientele on the cathedral steps|work=[[Die Welt]]|accessdate=11 February 2016}}{{de icon}}</ref>
While covering the Cologne Carnival live for Belgian television, reporter [[Esmeralda Labye]] was groped by attackers, who were apparently of European origin and whom Labye described as speaking German.<ref name="CNN_Labye">{{cite web|author=Merieme Arif|author2=Ben Brumfield|title=In Cologne, reporter groped while covering Carnival on live television|work=CNN|date=6 February 2016|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/02/06/europe/cologne-reporter-groped/index.html|accessdate=9 February 2016}}</ref> One of the attackers, a 17-year-old man, turned himself in to the police the following day, accompanied by his mother. However, he denied that his actions were sexually motivated.
